metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5951 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in eXtplorer 2.1.3, when used as a component for Joomla!, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the PATH_INFO to (1) application.js.php in scripts/ or (2) admin.php, (3) copy_move.php, (4) functions.php, (5) header.php, or (6) upload.php in include/.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

extplorer - 2.1.0b6+dfsg.3-4+deb7u1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: extplorer package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0b6+dfsg.3-4+deb7u1').
